revised_title: Effects of Latitude and Climate on Field Mouse Breeding
tldr: This study investigates the effects of latitude and climate on the breeding of the field mouse (Microtus agrestis). Researchers found that breeding conditions are attained latest in the most southerly station and are retained latest in the most northerly station. The study also reveals a correlation between the hours of sunshine and reproduction, with mice breeding in months with more than about 100 hours of sunshine.
